data.title: Viewing online file analysis results for 'LANC PCPS (lancremasteredpcps.com).exe'
data.meta_description: Submit malware for free analysis with Falcon Sandbox and Hybrid Analysis technology. Hybrid Analysis develops and licenses analysis tools to fight malware.
data.text:
Execution ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1559 Inter-Process Communication

Execution

Adversaries may abuse inter-process communication (IPC) mechanisms for local code or command execution. Learn more

Connects to LPC ports

T1106 Native API

Execution

Adversaries may interact with the native OS application programming interface (API) to execute behaviors. Learn more

Imports suspicious APIs

Calls an API typically used to retrieve function addresses

Calls an API typically used to create a process

Contains ability to execute an application (API string)

Contains ability to execute Windows APIs

Contains ability to execute application (Dotnet)

Found Native API in Dotnet file

Contains ability to create a new process (API string)

T1129 Shared Modules

Execution

Adversaries may execute malicious payloads via loading shared modules. Learn more

Loads modules at runtime

Calls an API typically used to load libraries

Looks up procedures from modules (excluding apphelp.dll, kernel32.dll, user32.dll, gdi32.dll, ole32.dll, comctl32.dll, uxtheme.dll, oleaut32.dll, version.dll, msctfime.ime)

Loads the RPC (Remote Procedure Call) module DLL

Loads the .NET runtime environment

Loads rich edit control libraries

T1059.003 Windows Command Shell

Execution

Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution. Learn more

Runs shell commands

T1059 Command and Scripting Interpreter

Execution

Adversaries may abuse command and script interpreters to execute commands, scripts, or binaries. Learn more

Executes batch file

T1047 Windows Management Instrumentation

Execution

Adversaries may abuse Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI) to execute malicious commands and payloads. Learn more

Found a reference to a WMI query string known to be used for VM detection

1 confidential indicators

Persistence ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1574.002 DLL Side-Loading

Persistence

Defense Evasion

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by side-loading DLLs. Learn more

Fails to load modules at runtime

T1543.003 Windows Service

Persistence

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may create or modify Windows services to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence. Learn more

Creates or modifies windows services

Contains ability to access device drivers

T1546.015 Component Object Model Hijacking

Privilege Escalation

Persistence

Adversaries may establish persistence by executing malicious content triggered by hijacked references to Component Object Model (COM) objects. Learn more

Overview of unique CLSIDs touched in registry

T1574.001 DLL Search Order Hijacking

Persistence

Defense Evasion

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

Privilege Escalation ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1055.003 Thread Execution Hijacking

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject malicious code into hijacked processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

Creates a thread in a self process

T1055 Process Injection

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

Allocates virtual memory in a remote process

Contains ability to inject code into another process (API string)

Found PE header in memory

T1574.002 DLL Side-Loading

Persistence

Defense Evasion

Privilege Escalation

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Calls an API typically used to enable or disable privileges in the specified access token

T1543.003 Windows Service

Persistence

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may create or modify Windows services to repeatedly execute malicious payloads as part of persistence. Learn more

Creates or modifies windows services

Contains ability to access device drivers

T1546.015 Component Object Model Hijacking

Privilege Escalation

Persistence

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject malicious code into process via Extra Window Memory (EWM) in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

Defense Evasion ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1562.001 Disable or Modify Tools

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may modify and/or disable security tools to avoid possible detection of their malware/tools and activities. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

Tries to map intranet network resources to internet zone

T1055.003 Thread Execution Hijacking

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject malicious code into hijacked processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

Creates a thread in a self process

T1622 Debugger Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid debuggers. Learn more

Queries kernel debugger information

T1070.004 File Deletion

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may delete files left behind by the actions of their intrusion activity. Learn more

Opens file with deletion access rights

Marks file for deletion

Contains ability to delete files

T1055 Process Injection

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject code into processes in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

Allocates virtual memory in a remote process

Contains ability to inject code into another process (API string)

Found PE header in memory

T1574.002 DLL Side-Loading

Persistence

Defense Evasion

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by side-loading DLLs. Learn more

Fails to load modules at runtime

T1027 Obfuscated Files or Information

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may attempt to make an executable or file difficult to discover or analyze by encrypting, encoding, or otherwise obfuscating its contents on the system or in transit. Learn more

CRC value set in PE header does not match actual value

3 confidential indicators

Loads the Bcrypt module DLL

Contains ability to use Cryptographic classes

Contains CRYPTO related strings

Matched Compiler/Packer signature (DIE)

Contains ability to perform crypto operations

Dotnet file resource with suspicious entropy

Shows ability to obfuscate file or information

T1140 Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may use Obfuscated Files or Information to hide artifacts of an intrusion from analysis. Learn more

2 confidential indicators

Contains ability to load content into memory (Dotnet)

Contains ability to decode base64 data

Shows ability to deobfuscate/decode files or information

T1134 Access Token Manipulation

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may modify access tokens to operate under a different user or system security context to perform actions and bypass access controls. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to enable or disable privileges in the specified access token

T1620 Reflective Code Loading

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may reflectively load code into a process in order to conceal the execution of malicious payloads. Learn more

Loads the CLR Loader DLL

Can loads assembly that contains the code that is currently executing [Dotnet]

Dotnet code contains potential unpacker

T1112 Modify Registry

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to hide configuration information within Registry keys, remove information as part of cleaning up, or as part of other techniques to aid in persistence and execution. Learn more

Modifies proxy settings

2 confidential indicators

Accesses System Certificates Settings

T1070 Indicator Removal

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may delete or modify artifacts generated within systems to remove evidence of their presence or hinder defenses. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

T1574.001 DLL Search Order Hijacking

Persistence

Defense Evasion

Privilege Escalation

Adversaries may execute their own malicious payloads by hijacking the search order used to load DLLs. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

T1036 Masquerading

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may attempt to manipulate features of their artifacts to make them appear legitimate or benign to users and/or security tools. Learn more

Drops files inside appdata directory

T1027.002 Software Packing

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may perform software packing or virtual machine software protection to conceal their code. Learn more

PE file has unusual entropy sections

PE file has unusual entropy resources

Matched Compiler/Packer signature

T1564.003 Hidden Window

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may use hidden windows to conceal malicious activity from the plain sight of users. Learn more

Contains ability execute applications in hidden mode (Dotnet)

T1027.005 Indicator Removal from Tools

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may remove indicators from tools if they believe their malicious tool was detected, quarantined, or otherwise curtailed. Learn more

Contains XOR operation loops [Stream disassembly]

T1497 Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments. Learn more

Contains ability to detect virtual environment (API)

T1070.006 Timestomp

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may modify file time attributes to hide new or changes to existing files. Learn more

Contains ability to query local/system time as file time

Contains ability to retrieve file time (API string)

T1497.003 Time Based Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various time-based methods to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments. Learn more

Contains ability to delay the execution of current thread

Contains ability to retrieve the time elapsed since the system was started (API string)

T1564 Hide Artifacts

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may attempt to hide artifacts associated with their behaviors to evade detection. Learn more

Found virtual disk drive like strings

T1055.011 Extra Window Memory Injection

Privilege Escalation

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may inject malicious code into process via Extra Window Memory (EWM) in order to evade process-based defenses as well as possibly elevate privileges. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

T1480 Execution Guardrails

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may use execution guardrails to constrain execution or actions based on adversary supplied and environment specific conditions that are expected to be present on the target. Learn more

Shows ability to use execution guardrails

Credential Access ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1056.001 Keylogging

Collection

Credential Access

Adversaries may log user keystrokes to intercept credentials as the user types them. Learn more

Calls an API typically used for keylogging

Found strings related to keylogger

T1056.004 Credential API Hooking

Collection

Credential Access

Adversaries may hook into Windows application programming interface (API) functions to collect user credentials. Learn more

Installs hooks/patches the running process

T1555 Credentials from Password Stores

Credential Access

Adversaries may search for common password storage locations to obtain user credentials. Learn more

Contains string like password/secret

Discovery ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1057 Process Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to get information about running processes on a system. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

Calls an API typically used for taking snapshot of the specified processes

Calls an API typically used to determine if process is running under WOW64

Spawns new processes

Spawns new processes that are not known child processes

Contains ability to enumerate process and/or its information (API string)

T1082 System Information Discovery

Discovery

An adversary may attempt to get detailed information about the operating system and hardware, including version, patches, hotfixes, service packs, and architecture. Learn more

Found system commands related strings

1 confidential indicators

Calls an API typically used to get product type

Calls an API typically used to get system version information

Calls an API typically used to retrieve information about the current system

Queries volume information

Calls an API typically used to retrieve OS information

Calls an API typically used to open an existing named mutex object

Reads the active computer name

Reads the cryptographic machine GUID

Contains ability to read software policies

Reads information about supported languages

Read system defined device setup information from registry

Contains ability to retrieve environment variable settings

Contains ability to retrieve data about the local computer (API string)

References to WMI query strings used to retrieve network adapter information

References to WMI query strings used for information discovery

T1083 File and Directory Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may enumerate files and directories or may search in specific locations of a host or network share for certain information within a file system. Learn more

Reads configuration files (.ini files)

Calls an API's typically used for searching a directory for a files

Touches files

Tries to access non-existent files (non-executable)

Tries to access non-existent files (executable)

Touches files in the Windows directory

Reads files

Contains ability to retrieve file and directory information (API string)

References Windows filepaths for DLLs (possible dropped files)

T1614 System Location Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may gather information in an attempt to calculate the geographical location of a victim host. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to retrieve local language

T1033 System Owner/User Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to identify the primary user, currently logged in user, set of users that commonly uses a system, or whether a user is actively using the system. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to retrieve account information for specified SID

Contains ability to retrieve user privileges (API string)

T1622 Debugger Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid debuggers. Learn more

Queries kernel debugger information

T1012 Query Registry

Discovery

Adversaries may interact with the Windows Registry to gather information about the system, configuration, and installed software. Learn more

2 confidential indicators

Opens registry keys

Queries registry keys

Queries TCP/IP interface details

Accesses Software Policy Settings

Contains registry location strings

T1010 Application Window Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of open application windows. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to get handle of currently active window

Calls an API typically used to get active windows title

Calls an API possibly used to retrieve a handle to the foreground window

T1007 System Service Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may try to gather information about registered local system services. Learn more

Queries services related registry keys

T1614.001 System Language Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to gather information about the system language of a victim in order to infer the geographical location of that host. Learn more

Reads the windows installation language

T1518 Software Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of software and software versions that are installed on a system or in a cloud environment. Learn more

Reads the registry for installed applications

T1518.001 Security Software Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of security software, configurations, defensive tools, and sensors that are installed on a system or in a cloud environment. Learn more

Possibly tries to implement anti-virtualization techniques using MAC address detection

T1018 Remote System Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may attempt to get a listing of other systems by IP address, hostname, or other logical identifier on a network that may be used for Lateral Movement from the current system. Learn more

2 confidential indicators

T1016 System Network Configuration Discovery

Discovery

Adversaries may look for details about the network configuration and settings, such as IP and/or MAC addresses, of systems they access or through information discovery of remote systems. Learn more

Found a reference to an external IP address lookup service

Contains ability to retrieve network adapter information (Dotnet)

T1497 Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various means to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments. Learn more

Contains ability to detect virtual environment (API)

T1124 System Time Discovery

Discovery

An adversary may gather the system time and/or time zone from a local or remote system. Learn more

Contains ability to query machine time

Contains ability to retrieve machine time (API string)

T1497.003 Time Based Evasion

Discovery

Defense Evasion

Adversaries may employ various time-based methods to detect and avoid virtualization and analysis environments. Learn more

Contains ability to delay the execution of current thread

Contains ability to retrieve the time elapsed since the system was started (API string)

Lateral Movement ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1021 Remote Services

Lateral Movement

Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a service that accepts remote connections, such as telnet, SSH, and VNC. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to register an interface (RPC)

Collection ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1074.001 Local Data Staging

Collection

Adversaries may stage collected data in a central location or directory on the local system prior to Exfiltration. Learn more

Calls an API typically used to create a directory

Contains ability to create directories (API string)

T1113 Screen Capture

Collection

Adversaries may attempt to take screen captures of the desktop to gather information over the course of an operation. Learn more

Calls an API possibly used to take screenshots

T1005 Data from Local System

Collection

Adversaries may search local system sources, such as file systems and configuration files or local databases, to find files of interest and sensitive data prior to Exfiltration. Learn more

Writes files in a temp directory

Contains ability to upload data with network (Dotnet)

T1056.001 Keylogging

Collection

Credential Access

Adversaries may log user keystrokes to intercept credentials as the user types them. Learn more

Calls an API typically used for keylogging

Found strings related to keylogger

T1056.004 Credential API Hooking

Collection

Credential Access

Adversaries may hook into Windows application programming interface (API) functions to collect user credentials. Learn more

Installs hooks/patches the running process

Command and Control ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1105 Ingress Tool Transfer

Command and Control

Adversaries may transfer tools or other files from an external system into a compromised environment. Learn more

Writes a PE file header to disc

Drops executable files

Contains ability to retrieve remote user information

Contains ability to copy files

Dropped files

Drops executable files inside temp directory

Drops Windows batch files

Contains ability to download files with network (Dotnet)

T1573.002 Asymmetric Cryptography

Command and Control

Adversaries may employ a known asymmetric encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Learn more

2 confidential indicators

T1071 Application Layer Protocol

Command and Control

Adversaries may communicate using OSI application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Learn more

Found potential IP address in binary/memory

1 confidential indicators

Contacts server

Found potential URL in binary/memory

Contains ability to communicate with network (API string)

Found potential URLs in memory dumps

T1071.001 Web Protocols

Command and Control

Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with web traffic to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Learn more

Sends traffic on typical HTTP outbound port, but without HTTP header

2 confidential indicators

Contains ability to provide interface for network protocols (Dotnet)

Contains ability to communicate with network (Dotnet)

T1573 Encrypted Channel

Command and Control

Adversaries may employ a known encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Learn more

Uses HTTPS for communication

Making HTTPS connections using secure TLS/SSL version

Possibly tries to communicate over SSL connection (HTTPS)

T1071.004 DNS

Command and Control

Adversaries may communicate using the Domain Name System (DNS) application layer protocol to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Learn more

Queries DNS server

T1071.003 Mail Protocols

Command and Control

Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols associated with electronic mail delivery to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic. Learn more

Contains reference to Mail transfer protocol

T1571 Non-Standard Port

Command and Control

Adversaries may communicate using a protocol and port pairing that are typically not associated. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

References server/domain address with port number

T1090 Proxy

Command and Control

Adversaries may use a connection proxy to direct network traffic between systems or act as an intermediary for network communications to a command and control server to avoid direct connections to their infrastructure. Learn more

Contains references to RPC protocol sequence strings

T1573.001 Symmetric Cryptography

Command and Control

Adversaries may employ a known symmetric encryption algorithm to conceal command and control traffic rather than relying on any inherent protections provided by a communication protocol. Learn more

Shows ability to use encryption for command and control traffic

Exfiltration ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1041 Exfiltration Over C2 Channel

Exfiltration

Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel. Learn more

1 confidential indicators

T1029 Scheduled Transfer

Exfiltration

Adversaries may schedule data exfiltration to be performed only at certain times of day or at certain intervals. Learn more

Contains ability to perform scheduled transfer (API string)

Impact ATT&CK ID Name Tactics Description Malicious Indicators Suspicious Indicators Informative Indicators T1486 Data Encrypted for Impact

Impact

Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems or on large numbers of systems in a network to interrupt availability to system and network resources. Learn more

2 confidential indicators

T1529 System Shutdown/Reboot

Impact

Adversaries may shutdown/reboot systems to interrupt access to, or aid in the destruction of, those systems. Learn more

Contains ability to shutdown system
